message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.IT. 

This paper proposes a solution to peak-hour broadband congestion by using smart home gateways to allocate bandwidth in a decentralized manner. The solution involves designing a credit allocation and redistribution mechanism, which falls under the category of network protocols and algorithms (cs.NI). The paper also discusses security and privacy concerns related to the proposed solution, which falls under the category of cryptography and security (cs.CR). Additionally, the paper involves implementing the solution on commodity wireless routers, which falls under the category of distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC). The solution also involves optimizing the allocation of bandwidth based on relative priorities, which falls under the category of control systems (cs.SY) and information theory (cs.IT).
